full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement
#### W3555-249613 Small Fiber Laser Cutting System

**Reference Number:** WS4030378694

We are soliciting bids for a single (1) Small Fiber Laser Cutting System.

**Background**
The Department of National Defence (DND) has a requirement for a small fiber laser cutting system. The chosen vendor will be responsible for providing a comprehensive system that meets the DND objectives.

**Eligibility and Tendering**
This tender is open to any eligible contractor. We will be selecting the winning bidder based on the lowest priced submission.

**Submission Information**
To learn more about this tender opportunity, please visit the Ariba Discovery website at [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17695195?extsite=MTc2OTUxOTVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17695195?extsite=MTc2OTUxOTVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==).

**Contract Details**
We expect the selected contract to be executed under the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), the Canada-EU Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA). The chosen vendor must be able to supply the system from British Columbia. 

**Tender Closing Date:**
The tender closes at 14:00 Eastern Standard Time (EST) on 2023-11-08.

The documentation will be available in both French and English.

### Contact Information
If you have any questions or concerns regarding this tender opportunity, please reach out to:

Anthony Mitch (SPAC/PSPC)
mitch.anthony@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Important Dates
*    2023-10-11 – Tender publication date
*    2023-11-08 (14:00 EST) – Tender closing date

The information provided in this announcement is the latest version available, but is subject to change. The vendor must ensure they carefully review the documentation and bid information provided. We are not responsible for any errors or inaccuracies occurring in the documentation. 

### Eligible Regions
The chosen vendor must be able to supply the system from British Columbia. Additionally, both English and French documentation will be available.  If you are a vendor interested in supplying this equipment, we encourage you to participate.
